title: Restaurant blast near Toronto injures 15 as suspects flee - MarketWatch
text:
Published: May 25, 2018 6:55 a.m. ET Share
Motive remains unclear Reuters The incident late Thursday, in Mississauga, Ontario, comes about a month after a man plowed a van into people walking along a busy Toronto thoroughfare, killing 10.
By MarketWatch
TORONTO—Fifteen people were injured after a bomb went off in an Indian restaurant in a Toronto suburb Thursday night, local police said.
Police Sgt. Matt Bertram said early Friday that police are seeking two men who entered the restaurant with their faces partially covered and allegedly detonated an explosive device around 10:30 p.m. before fleeing the scene.
He said police are pursuing the suspects and their motive remains unclear. “We’ve got nothing to indicate at this time that this was a terrorist attack,” Sgt. Bertram said.
The restaurant, the Bombay Bhel, is located in the city of Mississauga, west of Toronto.
The injured were taken to local hospitals, he said. Three people who were earlier in critical condition have been upgraded to stable, while most of the other 12 have been treated for minor injuries and released, he said.
